subject: Data
title: Key-Value Stores: Redis and the Speed of Simplicity
description: One-minute skill: Key-Value Stores: Redis and the Speed of Simplicity.

hook.text: A website needs to check if a user session is valid. A full SQL query takes 50 ms. Redis returns the answer in 0.1 ms.

buildup.text: Key-value stores are the simplest databases: give a key, get a value. No joins, no schemas, just raw speed.

discovery.text: Redis stores data in memory rather than on disk, achieving sub-millisecond response times for billions of lookups.

twist.text: Memory is expensive and volatile. Early Redis users learned the hard way that power outages erase everything.

climax.text: Key-value stores showed that not every data problem needs a complex database â€” sometimes simple is superior.

punchline.text: One key, one value, one microsecond. Simplicity wins.

quiz.question: Why are key-value stores like Redis so fast?
options: They store data in memory with a simple key-value model
